stadium.name: Wembley Stadium
stadium.significance: Home to the England national football team and hosts major events like the FA Cup Final, UEFA Champions League Final, and concerts.
stadium.eventsHosted: FA Cup Final, UEFA Champions League Final, Concerts

stadium.name: Camp Nou
stadium.significance: Home of FC Barcelona, one of the most successful football clubs in the world.
stadium.famousEvent: Numerous El Clásico matches between FC Barcelona and Real Madrid
stadium.architect: Francesc Mitjans, Josep Soteras, and Lorenzo García-Barbón
stadium.eventsHosted: El Clásico, UEFA Champions League matches

stadium.name: Old Trafford
stadium.significance: Known as "The Theatre of Dreams," it is the home of Manchester United.
stadium.famousEvent: Hosting Premier League matches and European competitions
stadium.eventsHosted: Premier League matches, UEFA Champions League matches

stadium.name: Maracanã Stadium
stadium.significance: One of the largest and most iconic football stadiums in the world.
stadium.architect: Waldir Ramos, Raphael Galvão, and Miguel Feldman
stadium.primaryTenants: Brazil national football team, Flamengo, Fluminense
stadium.eventsHosted: FIFA World Cup Finals, Olympic Games

stadium.name: Yankee Stadium
stadium.significance: Home of the New York Yankees, one of the most successful teams in Major League Baseball.
stadium.eventsHosted: World Series games, MLB All-Star Game

stadium.name: Madison Square Garden
stadium.significance: Known as "The World's Most Famous Arena," it hosts New York Knicks (NBA) and New York Rangers (NHL) games.

stadium.primaryTenants: New York Knicks, New York Rangers
stadium.eventsHosted: NBA games, NHL games, concerts, boxing matches

stadium.name: Estadio Azteca

stadium.primaryTenants: Mexico national football team, Club América
stadium.eventsHosted: FIFA World Cup Finals, Olympic Games
